verses.kjv: How hast thou helped him that is without power? how savest thou the arm that hath no strength?
verses.ct: "What great help you've been to the powerless! How well you've rescued the weak!

verses.kjv: How hast thou counselled him that hath no wisdom? and how hast thou plentifully declared the thing as it is?
verses.ct: What wonderful advice you've given to someone lacking wisdom! And what an abundance of insight you've shared!

verses.kjv: To whom hast thou uttered words? and whose spirit came from thee?
verses.ct: Who exactly are you speaking these words for? And whose spirit was inspiring you?

verses.kjv: Dead things are formed from under the waters, and the inhabitants thereof.
verses.ct: The dead tremble beneath the waters, along with everything that lives there.

verses.kjv: Hell is naked before him, and destruction hath no covering.
verses.ct: The realm of the dead lies exposed before God, and the place of destruction has nothing to hide it.

verses.kjv: He stretcheth out the north over the empty place, and hangeth the earth upon nothing.
verses.ct: He stretches the northern skies over empty space and suspends the earth over nothing.

verses.kjv: He bindeth up the waters in his thick clouds; and the cloud is not rent under them.
verses.ct: He wraps up the waters in his dense clouds, yet the clouds don't split apart under their weight.

verses.kjv: He holdeth back the face of his throne, and spreadeth his cloud upon it.
verses.ct: He conceals the front of his throne, spreading his clouds over it.

verses.kjv: He hath compassed the waters with bounds, until the day and night come to an end.
verses.ct: He drew a circular boundary on the surface of the waters, at the border where light meets darkness.

verses.kjv: The pillars of heaven tremble and are astonished at his reproof.
verses.ct: The pillars of heaven shake and stand stunned when he rebukes them.

verses.kjv: He divideth the sea with his power, and by his understanding he smiteth through the proud.
verses.ct: By his power he stills the sea, and by his understanding he strikes down the proud.

verses.kjv: By his spirit he hath garnished the heavens; his hand hath formed the crooked serpent.
verses.ct: By his spirit the heavens were made beautiful; his hand pierced the fleeing serpent.

verses.kjv: Lo, these are parts of his ways: but how little a portion is heard of him? but the thunder of his power who can understand?
verses.ct: And yet, these are just the outer edges of what he does. We catch only a faint whisper of him! So who could possibly comprehend the full thunder of his power?"
